body.p: A catalogue of inscribed objects from Nimrud created by Christopher Walker and a group of volunteers at the British Museum.

ul.li: You can view the catalogue's content here.

body.p: For general tips on browsing and searching Oracc catalogues, see the visitor help pages. {NB this link won't work until Oracc 3 goes live; meanwhile it's at visitor help pages.}

dl.dd: A stable running number identifying the database record. Records may be added or deleted from this database, but each record ID stays unchanged. For instance ID 1104 always refers to the tablet ND 4342 = IM 67547 = CTN 4, 98. You can use this ID to link stably to the item view, whether in print or online, e.g., http://oracc.org/nimrud/ood/noid/1104.
The ID field also acts as a link to the Item View page, which contains more information about the artefact.
The excavation number of the artefact. Objects which do not have an excavation number are catalogued with designations such as Unnumbered tablet.
A brief description of the artefact, e.g., writing board.

Gives the current institional location of the artefact, where known, including museum number, e.g., Melbourne IA.5.034. See the pages on museums holding Nimrud objects for further details of each collection.
Gives a brief bibliography for each item. See the CDLI wiki for a list of abbreviations and the page on online resources for downloadable PDFs, etc., where available.
The excavation number of the artefact, e.g., ND 453
Some Nimrud artefacts were given supplementary letters, e.g., ND 1106b. The supplementary letter is in the ND2 field.
In the pager, the ND and ND2 fields are combined to create the Designation field.
Gives the current institional location of the artefact, where known, including museum number, e.g., Melbourne IA.5.034. Identical to the Location field in the pager.
A brief classification of the type of artefact.
The primary material(s) from which the artefact was made, e.g., ivory.
The primary archaeological locus where the artefact was found, usually a building or a room within a building. The main abbreviations are:

ul.li: PD = soundings in the outer town, below the citadel
SEB = "South East Building", an area of Nabu's temple

dl.dd: More precise information on the artefact's archaeological findspot, where known.
A brief description of the artefact, e.g., writing board. Identical to the Description field in the pager listing.
The measurements of the artefact, where known.
A brief bibliography for the artefact. Identical to the Publication field in the pager listing.
Date BC of inscription, where known.
